captions.text: - Hello to my friends. Hello.
So today I just want to sit and talk
and hang out with you guys.
And so, how are you guys?
I'm really good.
I've had a crazy, crazy week.

This past Thursday, I
went and drove up to,
down to, over to, somewhere.

I went to San Diego for
the MTV Fandom Awards.
And it was just like a really fun evening.
I shot a whole bunch of commercials.
They were all on MTV and you guys

were tweeting me pictures
of you guys seeing it on TV.
So it's always fun to do TV stuff
because you guys get really excited

and I get really excited
because it's something

that I never even
dreamed I was able to do.
And so, for those awards to air

on actually MTV and for me
to introduce the evening
with Tyler Posey and present an award

to the Game of Thrones cast
and all of those things
was really, really cool, so that was fun.
Yeah, I had a lot of fun doing that
and I think you guys liked it too.

So if you saw it, let me
know what you thought.
And so yeah, that was Thursday night.

I got really, really, really,
really, really, really, really

really, um, I had a really
good time that night.
(laughing)

And then the next morning,
it was a struggle.
So we drove back Friday morning
and I was going through it in the car
because I was like, "Oh girl,
"I had too much fun the night before."

And I think part of it was
because we accidentally

went to a lesbian bar and
lesbians know how to do it.
And then we went to a gay bar
and it was full of porn stars

and porn stars, they
know how to do it too.
So the whole ride home on Friday

I was going through it,
but we made it back in time
for me to sit on my couch and just chill.
Because I had to prep for Sunday,

which was actually the CW's
Young Hollywood Awards,

where I was nominated for
viral superstar of the year.

I was up against a whole
bunch of my friends,
like Bethany Mota and Ryan Higa
and Jenna Marbles, who actually won.
And I was so, so proud of her.
Here's a picture of us at the awards show.
She was looking like, in her own words,
a galactic hooker and I was lookin' like
Caesar Flickerman from the Hunger Games.
It was all good.
We were livin' our dreams
and we felt like Internet people
that got to escape for the day.
It was a lot of fun. I walked the carpet.
I did a bunch of interviews.

It's just really fun to be
invited to things like this

because a lot of people in
the entertainment industry
kind of don't get it yet.
Like, you guys get it,

but a lot of the people
in charge of TV stuff

or movie or whatever
stuff, they don't quite get
why you guys watch YouTube
or why we make videos
or why that's even a thing.

And so to be invited and
to even have a category

that is dedicated to
people like us, honestly,
was the coolest thing in the world.
So, yeah, it was a lot of fun and yeah.
I'm trying to think what else is new.
I went to the Lady Gaga concert on last
Mmmmmmm was it Monday?
I don't know what day it was,

but I went to the Lady
Gaga concert last week.
It was amazing.

I think it was, like,
my, I want to say fourth
Lady Gaga concert that I've ever been to.

Maybe it was my fifth. Korey
and I were arguing about it.
I have no clue.
But it was really good. I loved it.

If you haven't seen her in
concert, go to the artRAVE.
It was incredible.
I was, like, dancin' my booty off
and the whole row behind us was you guys.
There was a whole bunch of you guys there.
And I was, like, gettin' down and freaky
and everything with you guys.
So I had a lot of fun.

Thank you to the Live Nation
who hooked a brotha up
and got me and Corey some kick-ass seats.

Even though I was
planning on going anyway,

you guys gave me the
hook-up, so thank you.

I appreciate it. I love you.
Can't wait for more concerts.
What else happening?
I'm wearing, look at this shirt.
Can I show you this shirt?
It says "Yay! Gay" on it
and it's from Tumblr themselves.
Tumblr has always been, like,
my favorite, favorite, favorite,
favorite, favorite thing in the world
and they sent me a really sweet message.
I wanna read it to you. Hold on.
Okay, so it came in this amazing card.
It says "Fuck yeah" on the front,
which I absolutely love,
and it says "Tyler, you're awesome.
"Tumblr's a home for everyone.
"Thank you for being you
"and inspiring, encouraging and empowering
"those that look up to you.
"XO, Tumblr"

So thank you to Tumblr
for this and this shirt.

And they even sent me a
whole bunch of stickers

and, like, these little
pins that have, like,
all the Tumblr logos on them.
And I have a whole bunch of them
so if you would like one,
I have plenty for myself,
but I wanna give some to you guys.
All you have to do to win is go to
tyleroakley.tumblr.com
Follow me and then come right back here.
Comment below with your Tumblr username
and I'm going to be picking, let's see,

three, four, five, six,
seven, eight, nine, ten.
I'm going to be picking 10 winners
and you are going to get this in the mail.
I'm gonna send them to you.
So all you gotta do, follow me on Tumblr
and then let me know your Tumblr username
in the comments below.
It's that simple. Go do it now.
What else is going on?
I am going to Summer in the City soon
and Vlogger Fair soon.

I'm announcing something
on Friday, August 1st.

I don't know if you guys
will know what it is,
but I think you can make a healthy guess.
I'm still doing my weekly countdown show
called Top That! on POPSUGAR Girls' Guide.
The link to that is right here.
Click this to subscribe.

I do a countdown with my
good friend, Becca Frucht.
Every single week we countdown

our top five favorite
things from the Internet
and from pop culture.
So if you'd like to subscribe to that,
all you gotta do is click right here
or the link will be below
and I would love it if you went over there
and subscribed and say that I sent ya.

Happy Little Pill came
out. You guys know that.

Happy Little Pill by my
good friend, Troye Sivan,
is the, I guess, smash song of the year
slash decade slash our generation.

If you haven't heard it
yet, the link is below.

I think this album could
debut at number one,

but it can't happen without
you guys getting involved.
So please get the album. Preorder it.
The link is below and when you preorder

you get Happy Little Pill,
the 1st single, immediately.
So you are gonna fall in love with it
and you're gonna be like, "Holy shit,
"this kid is incredible."
Or this man. He's 19. Whatever.

I'm trying to think what else
is up. I think that's it.
I should probably get going.

I'm, like, losing my
voice and I need to, like,

rest and stuff, but I hope
you have a fabulous life.
If you like these little update videos,
be sure to just give it a thumbs up

so I know that sometimes
I can just sit down
and talk to you because, honestly,
that's what I love doing
and that's how I started this channel,
just sitting here,
talking about what's going on in my life.

So if you like these videos,
let me know in the comments

and yeah, again, thank
you for being amazing.
I love you and (burp) ooh,
my goodness graciotious.
I guess I will go.
My latest Q and A is right there.
My latest Friday video's right there.
If you want to be my person of the week,
click right there.

And if you wanna subscribe,
it's right there.
I have new videos every week

except next month when
it gets a little crazy.
So yes, okay, that's all.
Good luck with your lives.
Goodbye.
(lively music)
It's really warm in my apartment
and I'm, like, very warm.
I'm having a very warm a-moment.

The only thing that will
help me get through it
is if you preorder T-R-X-Y-E on iTunes.
So you should do that.
Okay, goodbye.
